intro: Elephantopus paniculatus, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in panicles, blooming from late spring to early autumn. The plant is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
